DataElement.preferredName: Patient Seizure Disease or Disorder Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator of yes/no/unknown for an abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin in a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin in a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has history of seizure disorder requiring antipeleptics and has had a seizure episode within the last 6 months

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an uncontrolled seizure disorder?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known seizure disorder?
